name: compressed air energy storage plant construction, adiabatic, 150 MW electrical | compressed air energy storage plant, adiabatic, 150 MW electrical | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/25100/documentation

This dataset represents the construction of an adiabatic compressed air energy storage plant. This energy storage system is based on using electricity to compress air and store it in underground caverns or porous rock formation. The air is released when needed and passed through a turbine to generate electricity. The plant consists of an underground air storage, compressors, expanders, thermal energy storage and heat exchange units. The adiabatic compressed air energy storage (ACAES) system makes use of a thermal energy storage for heating up the outflow of air from the storage location. This is different to the (non-adiabatic) CAES (also available in the database) which uses a gas turbine burning natural gas. The ACAES system has an electricity consumption of 1.38 kWh per kWh electricity produced. ;Plant specifications:;plant rating: 150 MW;lifetime: 100 a;type of underground air storage: porous rock ("The porous rock formation does not have to be constructed and is considered to be of sufficient volume.") Assumption according to Bouman, Evert A.; Øberg, Martha M.; Hertwich, Edgar G. (2016): Environmental impacts of balancing offshore wind power with compressed air energy storage (CAES). In: Energy 95, p 91–98. DOI: 10.1016/j.energy.2015.11.041.

The activity starts with the arrival of the raw materials for plant construction and components at the construction site. As underground air storage porous rock formation is assumed. Therefore no construction of this part of the plant is considered. Inputs and preparation/processing of construction materials, energy requirements during construction and land use are included.

The activity ends with the dismantling of the plant.
category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/422:Construction of utility projects/4220:Construction of utility projects

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The scope of the underlying literature source is Europe.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The plant consists of an underground air storage, compressors, expanders, thermal energy storage and heat exchange units, system target rating: 150 MW
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: inventory is completely based on literature data (Bouman et al. 2016)

exchanges.description:
Calculated Value. This exchange represents both a compressor as well as an expander for compressed energy storage.

Compressor: Power rating 207 MW, 1.5526E+05 kg (Bouman, 2016)
Expander: Power rating 150 MW, 1.1249E+05 kg (Bouman, 2016)

The amount of the compressor has been scaled to represent the weights given in Bouman (2016). The weight of the air compressor is 4600 kg (see general comment of production dataset).
